result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy Fathe Lowery

records.addlTxt: State's Supplemental Witness List, received and filed.
Letter from defendant re:  bail reduction.  (Timothy F. Lowery - #2022005929, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Defendant Timothy Fathe Lowery not in court, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Timothy Fathe Lowery.  Attorney Jennifer Tate for Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. EXPIRES 12-21-2022.
Defendant's Motion for Reduction of Bail.  (Timothy F. Lowery - #2022005929, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Timothy Fathe Lowery not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court for Timothy Fathe Lowery.  
Attorney Francesco Mineo for  Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference
Court advised this case was tabbed to this court in error and should be assigned to Branch 4.
Court ordered case transferred and adjourned for a Status in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy Fathe Lowery appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Lori Ann Kuehn in court in person for Timothy Fathe Lowery.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of case #82FE4. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective C. Donahue. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 19.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter from the Court to A. Lowery and copy mailed.
Letter re:  defendant.

Case calendared for a Preliminary Hearing on August 29, 2022 at 1:30pm. 
New date confirmed via email with attorney Kuehn.

signed and filed.
The court appointed Attorney Lori Kuehn  to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County a One - Fee of $60.00. Repayment to begins after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment. Case remains calendared for a hearing on 8-17-2022 at 8:30am.
Received and Filed by Ashley L.

Defendant Timothy Fathe Lowery not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause to: 8/17/2022 at 8:30a.m., Branch45    The matter is scheduled in the trial court for State vs Lee hearing.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion for modification of bond from Defendant ( Timothy Lowery 949 N 9th Street Milwaukee, Wi 53233)

Defendant Timothy Fathe Lowery not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for Preliminary hearing. State Public Defenders Office needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Timothy Fathe Lowery not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact order signed and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Curtis E S Jr.; Erick A B; Monique A J
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Timothy Fathe Lowery in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Timothy Fathe Lowery in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Timothy Fathe Lowery appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense motion to dismiss arguned and denied by the court. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
